Watch this video to understand what learning will look like in LSR7 as we prepare for the start of the 2020-21 school year.

Our Board of Education voted Aug. 25 on our back-to-school plan, and many of our families have questions about what it means for the educational experience. Learn more about the science supporting teaching Pre-K to third grade in person, the hard work behind developing R-7 Online Academy, virtual learning, what hybrid learning could look like and more.

Superintendent Dr. David Buck and Executive Director of Public Relations Katy Bergen hosted a masked, socially distant conversation with Assistant Superintendent of Secondary Education Dr. Don Andrews, Assistant Superintendent of Elementary Education Dr. Patrick Shelton and Director of Instructional Technology Kyle Pace. STA digital media technology teacher Shawn Harrel produced this video from the Summit Technology Academy studios.

More info on our Roadmap to Reopening - https://www3.lsr7.org/reopening/

Across LSR7, 376 students received state recognition for their excellence in learning different languages.

On the high school level, 126 graduated seniors received the Missouri Seal of Biliteracy from the Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education. On the elementary and middle school levels, the Pathway Awards program recognized 250 students who either pursued opportunities to learn a second language or worked to maintain the native language spoken in the home.

LSR7 students and teachers persevered with their assessments, despite facing challenges due to the COVID-19 pandemic. #R7Proud

This January, LSR7 students took home gold, silver and bronze in both the high school and middle school divisions of the State Round of the National Youth Cyber Defense Competition, part of the CyberPatriot program.

CyberPatriot aims to educate and motivate students toward STEM disciplines, including cybersecurity, which has a predicted job growth of 32% through 2028.

Summit Technology Academy students won first, second and third place in the Platinum Tier. All teams of LSR7 middle school students qualified for state semifinals, Summit Lakes Middle School students won 2nd and 3rd place, and Bernard Campbell Middle School students won 1st place.

Congratulations to our students. We’re so proud of you.

Learn more about cybersecurity courses, internships and camps at STA here: https://sta.lsr7.org/courses/network-security/

The Board of Education is excited to announce Dr. David Buck as LSR7’s next superintendent. The Board voted to appoint Dr. Buck following a comprehensive search aided by search firm McPherson & Jacobson.

Dr. Buck will be formally introduced and welcomed into the LSR7 family at the regularly scheduled Board meeting on January 23, 2020. Dr. Buck’s tenure will begin on July 1, 2020. Dr. Buck has 24 years of experience in preK-12 education as a teacher, principal, assistant superintendent and superintendent.

The Board’s decision was guided by community feedback from public engagement sessions and online surveys, along with interview teams made up of more than 80 parents, students, teachers, administrators, support staff and community members. Thank you to our LSR7 community for your perspectives and engagement in this important process.

For more information about Dr. Buck’s education, experience and beliefs, read more here: https://lsr7.org/news/lees-summit-r-7-board-of-education-appoints-dr-david-buck-as-next-superintendent/
